bill.title: Collection Agencies; Exempt Out-of-State; Limitations; Disciplinary Action; Fines
bill.description: Clarifies and strengthens enforcement provisions for exempt out-of-state collection agencies and increases fines for collection agencies governed under chapter 443B, Hawaii Revised Statutes. (HB2508 HD1)

history.action: (H) Pending introduction.
(H) Introduced and Pass First Reading.
(H) Referred to CPC, FIN, referral sheet 7
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Monday, 01-30-12 2:00PM in House conference room 325.

(H) The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 11 Ayes: Representative(s) Herkes, Yamane, Brower, Coffman, Ito, Keith-Agaran, Luke, Souki, Tsuji, Ching, Marumoto; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 4 Excused: Representative(s) Cabanilla, Carroll, McKelvey, Thielen.
(H) Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 106-12), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to FIN.
(H) Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and McKelvey, Takai excused (2).
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Monday, 02-27-12 4:00PM in House conference room 308.

(H) The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 16 Ayes: Representative(s) Oshiro, M. Lee, Choy, Cullen, Giugni, Har, Hashem, Ichiyama, Jordan, Kawakami, C. Lee, Morikawa, Tokioka, Yamashita, Marumoto, Riviere; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Ward.
(H) Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 850-12) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Third Reading.
(H) Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 03-06-12.
(H) Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
(S) Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 227).
(S) Passed First Reading.
(S) Referred to CPN, WAM.
(S) The committee(s) on CPN has scheduled a public hearing on 03-13-12 9:00AM in conference room 229.

(S) The committee(s) on CPN recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in CPN were as follows: 6 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, Taniguchi, Green, Nishihara, Solomon, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Galuteria.
(S) Reported from CPN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2836) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and referral to WAM.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
(S) The committee(s) on WAM will hold a public decision making on 03-28-12 9:30AM in conference room 211.

(S) The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in WAM were as follows: 11 Aye(s): Senator(s) Ige, Kidani, Chun Oakland, Dela Cruz, English, Fukunaga, Kahele, Ryan, Tokuda, Wakai, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Espero, Kim, Kouchi.
(S) Reported from WAM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3222) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading.
(S) One Day Notice 04-10-12.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Third Reading. Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
(H) Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 499).
(H) Transmitted to Governor.
